attributes.action: Stop using tax payers money to hide government jobs in the middle class Guardian newspaper and put them on the government website where they can be seen by all.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Government should not advertise vacancies in the Guardian newspaper, which few working class people are ever likely to want to read.  

A substantial sum will be saved by advertising all government vacancies on the government website, which is already there and will cost nothing extra to taxpayers.  It will be free to view and available to all, whatever our social class.  Those without computers can access them at job centres or the local library. 

This is certainly not social inclusion. Stop putting those vacancies in a middle class newspaper!

rejection.details: All government jobs are advertised on the civil service gateway website.
reasons: Wording that needs to be amended, or is impossible to understand
